content.description: Starts on a small quartz foothold and positive side-pull edge. Move up through two diverting cracks with good edges, eventually moving leftward to a very good ledge with no feet. Top out.
content.location: Halfway down the trail-side wall. Just past a project with two parallel cracks.

content.description: Quaint gulley with cliffs on either side. Nice little stream passing through and a peaceful setting overall. Trail side wall has plentiful highball options, while the cliff across the stream would give some power packed short routes. Rock quality is good, but parts are mossy and seepage is high. If you’re looking to get scared on some taller boulders, this is your ticket
